channel.title: Help in making an area multi on every height level
channel.description:
Hello reader
I'm currently attempting to make a minigame which is a lot like RFD or Fight Caves, but then like 10 times harder. Now, I got everything working, except the area I chose doesn't become multi on every height level, only on height 0. Any fixes for this?
Regards
JavaLearner

item.title: Help in making an area multi on every height level
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

Well because I’m not sure that the method that actually makes it multi will eventually make it multi on the specific height level.

EDIT: ROFL nvm, I edited my copy source and it works on there.

Read full topic
item.source: Help in making an area multi on every height level

item.title: Help in making an area multi on every height level
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Why don’t you just extend to that method and add height?

Read full topic
item.source: Help in making an area multi on every height level

item.title: Help in making an area multi on every height level
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

In the inMulti method you can only give the X and Y values for the rectangular which is formed.

I thought there was already a sort of system like that in here, but I guess not. I’ll try making a new method then I suppose?

Is there a method that actually makes a spot multi? Since inMulti only has the coordinates to eventually make it multi.

Read full topic
item.source: Help in making an area multi on every height level
